key_points: Tom Brady praises Tampa Bay Buccaneers coach Bruce Arians ahead of Super Bowl matchup against Kansas City Chiefs.
Brady highlights Arians' qualities as a great leader, person, and friend.
At 68, Arians will be the second-oldest head coach to participate in a Super Bowl.
Arians has won two Super Bowls as an assistant with the Pittsburgh Steelers.
Brady admires Arians for his hard coaching style and honesty, according to a documentary 'A Football Life'.
Despite criticisms from others about Arians' coaching style, Brady values his honesty and high expectations.
Brady mentions his strong affection and respect for Arians, emphasizing the team's desire to win for him.
Arians is characterized as endearing and respected by those around him.
Arians previously won the AP Coach of the Year award twice.
Arians acknowledges Brady's significant impact on the team's belief and success.
spokespersons: Bruce Arians (Head Coach, Tampa Bay Buccaneers)
